name: lectrote
description: The Quixe/GlkOte IF interpreter in an Electron shell

packageJSON.name: lectrote
packageJSON.description: Lectrote: the Glulx/Ink IF interpreter in an Electron shell

scripts.preinstall: if [ -f quixe/LICENSE ]; then echo Quixe already installed; elif [ -d .git ]; then git submodule init; git submodule update; else git clone https://github.com/erkyrath/quixe.git; fi

releases.name: Release 1.2.1
releases.body:
- Added CSS customizations for ZVM.
- ZVM fix for freezes and status-line issues that occured in many Inform 6 games.
- (But I6 quote boxes, e.g. in Curses, still don't work.)
- Includes inkjs 1.4.6 ([bug fix](https://github.com/y-lohse/inkjs/pull/48))
- Bump to Electron 1.4.13.

releases.name: Release 1.2.0
releases.body:
- Switched the Z-code engine to the current version of ZVM (from https://github.com/curiousdannii/ifvms.js). This uses the same display library as the other interpreters, so the margin preferences and everything else are now consistent. It also now supports Z-code V3.
- (But Z-code still does not autosave.)
- Updated to inkjs 1.4.5. (Ink language version 0.6.4, other bug fixes.)
- On Windows and Linux, the "Open Game" dialog will show all playable IF files by default.

releases.name: Release 1.1.8
releases.body:
- Added two new color styles: "sepia" and "slate". (Lower-contrast light and dark styles.)
- Bumped to Electron 1.4.8.

releases.name: Release 1.1.7
releases.body:
- Includes Quixe release 2.1.6.
- Includes inkjs 1.4.3 (Ink language 0.6.3).
- Also includes inkjs 1.3.0 (again), so we get back support for older Ink .json files. We now support compiled Ink format version 12 and up.

releases.name: Release 1.1.6
releases.body:
- Changing the Margins preference now causes a window rearrange event, so that the status line and other width-based layout is updated correctly.
- The Open dialog box now correctly shows .zblorb, .zlb, .z5, and .z8 files. (The current Parchment setup only supports those two Z-machine versions.)
- If you launch a game with the wrong Z-machine version, you get a visible error message instead of a silent failure.
- Bumped to Electron 1.4.4 (Node 6.5, Chrome 53).

releases.name: Release 1.1.5
releases.body:
- Includes inkjs 1.4.2 ([ink version 0.6.1](https://github.com/inkle/ink/releases/tag/0.6.1)).
- If an ink game includes a title (a top-level `#title:` tag), it is displayed as the window title.
- Fix for graphics windows being drawn with a slight extra lower margin.

releases.name: Release 1.1.4
releases.body:
I have added Z-machine support! In a very rough way. (This is a hasty hack to give users of MacOS 10.12 "Sierra" some hope, after a bunch of old interpreters failed on it.) Beware the many caveats:
- _No autosave._ You have to type SAVE before you close the window, or your progress is gone.
- Window resizing doesn't work right. If you make the window too narrow, the status line will wrap funny. You can close the window and reopen it to adjust this, but you'll have to do it again if you widen the window again.
- The font-size preference can run into status-line wrapping problems too.
- The dark-background preference does not reverse the status line. It probably also interacts poorly with Z-machine colored text.
- The margins preference doesn't work at all.
- The search widget can be partially or completely hidden behind the status line.
- After installing this, the open-file dialog may not list `.zblorb`, `.z5`, etc files. You may have to use the Finder to set the file association of these files to Lectrote.

Improvements since yesterday:
- Manual save and restore works now.
- Icons updated to say "ZCODE".
- Cleaned up the internal Parchment glue.
- Used minified Parchment code.

releases.name: Release 1.1.3
releases.body:
I have added Z-machine support! In a very rough way. (This is a hasty hack to give users of MacOS 10.12 "Sierra" some hope, after a bunch of old interpreters failed on it.) Beware the many caveats:
- You have just one save slot and it is volatile. If you close the game window, it is _gone_.
- Window resizing doesn't work right. If you make the window too narrow, the status line will wrap funny. You can close the window and reopen it to adjust this, but you'll have to do it again if you widen the window again.
- The font-size preference can run into status-line wrapping problems too.
- The dark-background preference does not reverse the status line. It probably also interacts poorly with Z-machine colored text.
- The margins preference doesn't work at all.
- The search widget can be partially or completely hidden behind the status line.
- Z-code file icons say "GLULX" because I didn't have time to edit them.
- After installing this, the open-file dialog may not list `.zblorb`, `.z5`, etc files. You may have to use the Finder to set the file association of these files to Lectrote.

Also: updated inkjs to version 1.2.0. (Ink language 0.5.1 plus bug fixes.)

releases.name: Release 1.1.2
releases.body: Updated inkjs to version 1.1.3. (Minor bug fixes.)

releases.name: Release 1.1.1
releases.body:
- Bumped to Electron 1.2.8 (Node 6, Chrome 51)
- Includes inkjs 1.1.1

releases.name: Release 1.1.0
releases.body:
Ink support! Thanks to @y-lohse's [inkjs](https://github.com/y-lohse/inkjs) package, Lectrote now allows you to play games written in Inkle's [Ink](http://www.inklestudios.com/ink) language. (The compiled `.json` format, not the `.ink` source files.)

The app subtitle is now "The Glulx/Ink IF interpreter..." in honor of this.

releases.name: Release 1.0.6
releases.body:
The preferences dialog now has an "Other Font..." option. You can enter the (CSS) name of any font installed on your computer. Caveats:
- The app has no way to check whether the font exists or is spelled correctly. You just have to try it.
- There's also no way to check whether the font has italics/bold available. If you use a font that don't have 'em, you might miss game styling.

Updated to the released Quixe 2.1.5. (Its features were already available via a prerelease version, so no changes here except the version label.)

releases.name: Release 1.0.5
releases.body:
Added "Find...", "Find Next", "Find Previous" menu options. Yes, the search highlights your input in the search widget, I know.

Added "Full Screen" menu option. (cmd-ctrl-F on Mac, F11 on Windows.)

releases.name: Release 1.0.4
releases.body: Fixed a stupid mistake which caused a fatal error in some games with graphics windows. (https://github.com/erkyrath/lectrote/issues/60)

releases.name: Release 1.0.3
releases.body:
- Bumped to Electron 1.0.2.
- If a long output causes MORE paging, there will be a small mark in the right margin indicating where the long output starts.
- The "Reset Game" menu option is disabled on non-game windows. (Except on MacOS, where disabling menu items is a nuisance and I haven't sorted it out yet.)

releases.name: Release 1.0.2
releases.body: Bumped to [Electron 1.0.1](http://electron.atom.io/blog/2016/05/11/electron-1-0).

releases.name: Release 1.0.1
releases.body:
- Graphics windows should now display at full resolution on high-res displays. (This was a problem playing Counterfeit Monkey on a Retina Mac, for example.)
- The IF reference card window can now be expanded (scaling up the card content). Shrinking it does not scale down the card; it scrolls instead.

releases.name: Release 1.0.0
releases.body:
1.0 -- out of beta!
- Added .blorb and .blb to the Mac app's filetype list.
- Updated to electron version 0.37.8.

releases.name: Beta 0.2.4
releases.body: Updated to electron version 0.37.6.

releases.name: Beta 0.2.3
releases.body: Updated to electron version 0.37.5.

releases.name: Beta 0.2.2
releases.body:
Updated to Electron 0.37.2 and Chrome 49.

I saw a bug report that the MacOS code signature might be rejected on MacOS 10.11.3 and earlier. (I am on 10.11.4; see https://github.com/atom/electron/issues/4899 .) Please let me know if this happens with Lectrote.

releases.name: Beta 0.2.1
releases.body:
- Fixed a bug where the zoom preference would leap unexpectedly to very small or very large.
- Automated the creation of a DMG installer for MacOS, with custom folder background and icon.
- Updated to Quixe 2.1.4 and Electron 0.36.11.

releases.name: Beta 0.2.0
releases.body:
Introducing: autosave! If you close the game window (or quit the interpreter) and then open it again, you will find your game where you left off.

The "Reset Game..." menu option will start over _without_ loading the autosave. This may be helpful if you run into an autosave bug which prevents the game from running at all.

The Mac binary is now packaged as a DMG (disk image) file, which will hopefully take care of the code signing issues.

releases.name: Beta 0.1.6
releases.body:
- Preferences dialog! (Hit `cmd-comma`.) This lets you set the font, color theme (dark/light), and also the previously-available zoom and margin preferences. (Margin has been moved out of the View menu. Zoom remains there for tradition's sake.)
- The body fonts in the preferences dialog are: Lora, Gentium Book, Georgia, Libre Baskerville, Helvetica, Source Sans Pro, and Courier. Lora, Gentium Book, Libre Baskerville, and Source Sans Pro are packaged; I am assuming the rest are generally available.
- The status line was previously a list of possible monospace fonts (Monaco, Andale Mono, Courier), so it appeared differently on different machines. It is now Source Code Pro, which is packaged, so it will always be available.
- Splash window now offers an option to "select a recently played game", assuming you've ever played a game.
- There is now a menu option for "Reset Game" (for the current window). This is not important right now (you could just close the window and re-open it), but it will become important when autosave works.
- `cli.sh` script now works whether you've installed the Lectrote Node package locally or globally.

Note: Although I've been signing the Mac binary, the signature isn't coming out of the zip file correctly. That's why you still get the "unidentified developer" warning. I've added a `Lectrote-0.1.6-macos-x64.dmg` file which I _think_ fixes this.

releases.name: Beta 0.1.5
releases.body:
- Fixed a bug where local variables could be corrupted after RESTORE. (This did not affect most games, but it caused a problem with Wade's CYOA extension.)
- Light/dark color theme preference.
- Green tint on the input line text, to make it more visible.

releases.name: Beta 0.1.4
releases.body:
- Fixed bug where a spurious "ENOENT" error dialog could appear at launch (MacOS).
- Fixed bug where the "MORE" button would never disappear.
- Zoom-in/out now bounded to a sensible range.
- Zoom-normal now has the traditional `cmd-0` shortcut.
- Scroll bar track becomes slightly more visible when active and hovered.
- The Open Game dialog accepts .blb and .glb files.
- Adjusted icons to look better at small sizes.
- The Mac app is signed! Also a much smaller download.

releases.name: Beta 0.1.3
releases.body:
- About page now displays the release Quixe version number (2.1.3).
- Fixed the Mac app icon (again). Added Mac icons for .ulx, .gblorb, .glksave, .glkdata.
- Associated a document icon with game windows on Win32.
- Set up a script to automate the `git submodule` step.
- If you install the package globally, there will be a `/usr/local/bin/lectrote` script to launch games from the command line.

Thanks to @curiousdannii for assorted NPM clues.

Tuesday update: the Mac app is now signed! Also a much smaller download. (I'm sneaking this into the release because it's a packaging change, not a code change.)

releases.name: Beta 0.1.2
releases.body:
- Improved game launching. You can now specify a game on the command line (`npm start game.ulx`).
- Multiple app launches are consolidated into a single process. (So you can no longer wind up with multiple About windows.)
- Launching the app via `npm start` no longer displays an error window.
- Set up electron-packager to do all the app packaging.
- When the game session ends (e.g., on a QUIT command) the window now displays a banner saying so.
- Removed the Undo and Redo menu options, as they didn't do what anybody wanted.
- Disabled the Cut and Paste menu options in the static windows (About and IF Reference). Also removed the View menu in the static windows.
- Moved the Developer Tools menu option to the Window menu.

releases.name: Beta 0.1.1
releases.body:
Fixed icons on Mac and Windows.

Windows and Linux apps should accept drag-drop game files now.

Speed optimization via @eevee.

Linux zip file will no longer spill files all over your current directory.

releases.name: Beta 0.1.0
releases.body:
What the heck, it basically runs.

Known issues:

Since it's Quixe underneath, there's no sound support.

When you save a game, you have to add the ".glksave" suffix yourself.

The "File / Open Recent..." menu is not properly updated.

The Mac binary is not signed. It may show up as "from an unidentified developer". (It should _not_ show up as "broken". Broken is bad.)

The Windows binaries have the Electron icon (blue-green) rather than my Lectrote icon (purple, compass rose).

The Quixe version number shows as "2.1.2". It's actually a pre-release 2.1.3.
